page.title: 15Fraserburgh Central Gazette
page.content: MARKET EXTENSION:- There are plans to build a new market. It will have 15 doors on the sea side and 6 on the land side with 2 doors on each end. There will be doors inside for chillers to keep fish cool. The estimated cost is Â£260,000. SLIP REPAIRS:- The harbour board are going to spend Â£3,000 on repairs to the slip. The repairs will be done in the summer holidays. LIFE_BOAT:- In May a replacement lifeboat came to Fraserburgh. It is called the "Douglas Currie". It is mark 2. They have it until they get the"CITY of EDINBURGH". TOURIST ATTRACTION:- It is proposed to employ a caretaker, working 9-5 daily for the l9 week summer season at a cost of Â£1200,to bring Maggie's Hoosie Cairnbulg, up to tourism standard..
